pullRequest.title: Remove Zookeeper TLS sidecars
pullRequest.bodyText:
Type of change

Enhancement / new feature

Description
After Kafka 2.3 support was dropped, we use only Zookeeper 3.5. That means we can switch to the native Zookeeper TLS support and stop using the sidecars in Zookeeper pods. That should allows us more flexibility for scaling etc. The sidecars are still used for Kafka, EO or CC.
This PR covers several closely related taks:

Removes the Zookeeper 3.4 support from CO and container image scripts
Removes the Zookeeper TLS sidecar and replaces it with native Zookeeper TLS support
Moves the ZOOKEEPER_NODE_COUNT environemnt variable into config map. Without the TLS sidecar, we can now scale Zookeeper up and down without rolling the old pods. But the environment variable was triggering rolling anyway. So moving it into config map avoids the unnecessary restarts.

Checklist

 Make sure all tests pass
 Try your changes from Pod inside your Kubernetes and OpenShift cluster, not just locally
 Update CHANGELOG.md

nodes.bodyText: Do we want to use a constant and reference it for the 2181 here

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * Remove ZooKeeper TLS sidecars and use native ZooKeeper TLS support instead
          
          
            
            * Remove TLS sidecars from ZooKeeper pods, using native ZooKeeper TLS support instead.
          
      
    
    
  

I think this makes it clearer that this change only affects the ZooKeeper server side of the connection, not the client side.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,6 +13,8 @@
 * Allow standalone User Operator to modify status on KafkaUser
 * Add support for Kafka 2.4.1
 * Add support for Kafka 2.5.0
+* Remove ZooKeeper TLS sidecars and use native ZooKeeper TLS support instead

nodes.bodyText:
Removing these properties is an incompatible change. I don't think that actually breaks anything on any of the versions of Kube which we support (since we're not using structural schemas), but if we were using structural schemas the existing CRs which specified this property would be rejected by the API server. So it might not cause any problems immediately until we make the CRD changes for structual schemas at which point users who still had this specified in their CRs would suddenly get errors.
Overall I think it might be safer to just leave the property in there, but mark it as @DeprecatedProperty and ignore it when it's set. We could remove it in v1beta2.

I know it doesn't matter as this is now deprecated, but isn't this technically the ZooKeeper TLS sidecar container?
Or do you refer to it as the kafka broker sidecar as its job is to speak to the kafka broker?
Might be missing something here, but don't we only add two things to data , not three?

FORBIDDEN_OPTIONS_EXCEPTIONS  might be a slightly better name just so that this isn't confused with EXCEPTIONS as in the throwable (highly unlikely I admit, but still probably best to stay consistent with where  we have used:
FORBIDDEN_PREFIXES
FORBIDDEN_PREFIXES_EXCEPTIONS
